amendment.description: To provide a statement of the exclusive means by which electronic surveillance and interception of certain communications may be conducted.

action.text: Proposed amendment SA 3910, pursuant to the order of January 31, 2008, having failed to achieve the required 60 votes in the affirmative, was withdrawn in Senate.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3910, pursuant to the order of January 31, 2008, having failed to achieve the required 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 41. Record Vote Number: 13.

action.text: Amendment SA 3910 proposed by Senator Feinstein to Amendment SA 3911. (consideration: CR S706-707; text: CR S706-707) To provide a statement of the exclusive means by which electronic surveillance and interception of certain communications may be conducted.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 3910, pursuant to the order of January 31, 2008, having failed to achieve the required 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 41. Record Vote Number: 13.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3910 proposed by Senator Feinstein to Amendment SA 3911.
